item.title: Cash For Clunker Cell Phones
item.description: While the government’s Cash for Clunkers program for cars might be ending, there’s a similar concept for old electronics. You can get cash for your unwanted devices, including cell phones, laptops, and more! You might not have heard about this, but it’s a great way to earn money from your unused gadgets. From cell phones and laptops to gaming consoles and cameras, many devices have value. Don’t let them sit around collecting dust â€“ see how much they’re worth!

item.title: Special Triple Savings To Call International
item.description: Calling other countries from the USA or Canada? You need to know about the special triple savings offer from TEL3Advantage. Here’s how it works: you get a 30% discount off their already low international calling rates for 30 days. Plus, you receive up to $9 in free talk time, which equates to 900 international minutes. This offer allows you to make calls globally at incredibly low rates, such as 1 cent per minute to China, 1.

item.title: Low Price Toll Free Numbers
item.description: If you need a toll-free number for your business and want an affordable option with excellent service, Kall8 might be the solution for you. Kall8 provides more than just a toll-free number; they offer a comprehensive set of phone services that enhance your mobile phone’s capabilities to rival your office phone. Before exploring these features, let’s discuss pricing. Kall8 offers low-cost toll-free numbers starting at $2, providing you with an 866, 877, or 888 number that’s active immediately.

item.title: Are You A Sentio Being?
item.description: If you’re someone who likes to stay ahead of the curve in technology without breaking the bank, now is the time to make a move. The LG Sentio, a free high-quality smartphone, is a prime example of getting significant value without spending a lot. You might be wondering how a high-value phone can be free. It’s a combination of taking advantage of technological advancements at the right moment and knowing where to find the best deals.

item.title: The Sweet Touch of LG Chocolate
item.description: The LG Chocolate Touch phone is a must-have, offering a delightful blend of style and functionality. Verizon has a hit with the LG Chocolate Touch, a phone that combines sleek design with powerful multimedia features. True to its name, the Chocolate Touch features a 3-inch touchscreen display with a sharp resolution of 400x240 pixels. It also boasts a 3.2-megapixel camera equipped with intelligent shot, panorama, facial makeover, and more. The camera captures stunning photos suitable for printing or instant sharing online and through multimedia messages.

item.title: RAZR Reincarnation
item.description: The original Motorola RAZR was a groundbreaking phone that redefined the industry, much like the iPhone did in its own time. Unlike the bulky phones available then, the RAZR stood out with its incredibly slim half-inch profile, all encased in a revolutionary aircraft-grade aluminum body. The new RAZR takes this legacy further with even more advanced technology and a thinner 0.3-inch (7.1 mm) design. The iconic aluminum case is replaced by laser-cut KEVLAR with Corning Gorilla Glass for screen protection and a splash-guard coating for water resistance.

item.title: Samsung Intercept Brings Free Android Smartphone to Sprint
item.description: A popular new smartphone design combines a 3-inch touchscreen, a slide-out QWERTY keyboard, and the Android operating system. Sprint offers this package in their Samsung Intercept model. Amazingly, you can get this phone for free when you order it online with a new Sprint PCS service plan. There are no additional costs; even shipping is free, and the plans are the same price as in stores. The Samsung Intercept M910 is a fantastic deal.

item.title: It's a Sidekick and a Running Mate
item.description: The T-Mobile Sidekick Slide is perfect for those who love to stay connected. Its compact design easily fits into your pocket, keeping you in touch even during a workout. While it functions as a cell phone, its primary use lies in its messaging capabilities. Accessing the full QWERTY keyboard is as simple as sliding the phone open, transforming it into a miniature computer. The large, vibrant display and physical keys enhance the user experience.

item.title: Earth Day Means Money For Electronics Recycling
item.description: Today is Earth Day, a day to appreciate nature and consider our impact. We should treat our planet with respect or face the consequences. Speaking of which, why not make some money while being environmentally conscious? It’s entirely possible to earn money by responsibly discarding old electronics. Even someone very frugal would see the value in making a little cash while helping the environment. Wouldn’t you agree? How about making some easy money through recycling?

item.title: Behold The Samsung Behold Espresso and Rose
item.description: It’s understandable why you’re looking for Samsung Behold reviews; it’s one of the most sought-after touchscreen phones on the market. The Samsung Behold is an advanced smartphone featuring Samsung’s innovative TouchWiz interface, taking touchscreen technology to new heights. TouchWiz allows you to personalize your home screen by simply dragging and dropping widgets with your finger, eliminating the need for a mouse or stylus. Beyond its impressive TouchWiz interface, the Samsung Behold offers an array of desirable features for a touchscreen phone.

item.title: Where Wireless Device Are Free
item.description: Mobile devices today are advancing at a similar rate to computers five to ten years ago. Remember constantly upgrading your desktop computer even though it still worked fine? The rapid software development quickly outpaced processor and memory capabilities. Large files from complex applications required additional storage drives. Today, computers have plateaued in their technological advancement, allowing us to fully utilize them before needing an upgrade. This applies particularly to laptops and notebooks, which often experience physical wear before their performance declines.

item.title: The Impressive Samsung Impression Phone
item.description: Get ready to be amazed by a groundbreaking cell phone display technology called AMOLED, short for Active Matrix Organic Light Emitting Diode. This technology delivers a sharper, more vibrant display that is also slimmer, lighter, and more energy-efficient. While it will soon be widely used in various mobile devices, you can currently experience AMOLED technology in the Samsung Impression A877 Blue cell phone. As cell phones continue to replace laptops, the demand for larger screens has increased.

item.title: Kinoma Mobile Media Tools
item.description: The mobile multimedia revolution is here, as evidenced by the constant competition among cell phone manufacturers to deliver bigger screens, better resolution, more memory, and faster wireless speeds. However, Kinoma is changing the game with a new toolset that enhances the capabilities of existing smartphones. At the forefront is Kinoma Play, a multimedia browser and guide. It supports a wide array of video formats, including MPEG-4 Video SP, AVC/H.264, 3GPP (MPEG-4), Flash Video (Sorenson Spark), QuickTime Movie (MPEG-4), and Windows Media 9 (WMV9).

item.title: LG Xenon Exotic Messaging Phone
item.description: The LG Xenon gets its name from the element Xenon, which gives off a blue glow when electrically charged, just like the blue version of this phone. But the red one is named for being “red hot” - a nod to its impressive messaging features. Messaging is the heart of the LG Xenon. It’s perfect for those who love to text, featuring a full-length slide-out QWERTY keyboard for effortless typing. And when you’re not messaging, the Xenon easily transitions back to a sleek and pocket-friendly candybar-style phone.

item.title: Cell Phone Family Plans for Professionals
item.description: Typically, “family plans” bring to mind adding lines for children. However, in the current economic climate, a family plan could be the difference between two working individuals each having a dedicated phone and being forced to share. Sharing a phone is impractical for business, so let’s explore these family plans further. You might not have considered this option for professional use due to the name “family plan.” These plans are more accurately described as shared minutes plans, but the name “family plan” has stuck, so we’ll use it here.

item.title: Recycle Your Cell Phone To Save A Gorilla
item.description: Recycling old cell phones is beneficial for many reasons, with one significant reason being the protection of the Eastern Lowland Mountain Gorilla in the Democratic Republic of Congo. You might wonder how cell phone usage impacts gorillas in Africa. The answer lies in the interconnected nature of our ecosystem. Cell phones contain various electronic components, including tantalum capacitors. Tantalum, a scarce and valuable metal, enables the miniaturization of capacitors, making them suitable for slim cell phones.

item.title: HTC HD2 Smartphone With Movies
item.description: Have you ever been offered a cell phone with two full-length movies already on it? That’s only the beginning of what the HTC HD2 smartphone for T-Mobile offers. This phone doesn’t just offer entertainment, it delivers it in spades! The massive touchscreen display immediately suggests this phone is designed for multimedia. It boasts a 4.3-inch screen with 800 x 480 pixel resolution. Those specs sound more like a small computer than a phone, and that’s a good thing.

item.title: Cell Phones Piling Up?
item.description: You’ve got a brand new Samsung touch screen phone for Christmas? That’s great! You’ll definitely enjoy it for the next few years. However, what about your old phone? The one you were using just yesterday? It still functions, doesn’t it? Don’t let it become another piece of holiday trash. Instead of feeling sentimental, consider this: Your Christmas tree will be discarded soon, and all that packaging will be recycled. Why not do the same with your old phone?

item.title: Local Telephone Service Provider Options
item.description: All homes and businesses require some form of local phone service. While this was once as simple as calling the phone company, more choices are now available, requiring careful consideration for the best deal. Traditional analog phone service, or “dial tone” service, uses century-old technology. With its established infrastructure and widespread availability, customers can still walk into a local phone company for service. However, exploring offers from both traditional and newer competitive carriers can lead to better options.

item.title: A Smartphone of Mythic Proportions
item.description: Thinking about a new smartphone? Don’t settle for just any phone when you can get a fantastic deal on the Samsung Mythic A897 Black for AT&T. This high-end phone is surprisingly available for free with an instant online discount and free shipping. What makes this phone so special? It boasts a vibrant 3.3-inch touchscreen display, perfect for enjoying AT&T Mobile TV and engaging in video calls with AT&T Video Share. This phone is also 3G and world-phone capable, operating on AT&T’s GSM network for extensive coverage.

item.title: Cash In Old Gadgets To Buy New Gadgets
item.description: The holiday shopping season is here, and with it comes the temptation of new electronics and gadgets. However, it’s also a time to be mindful of spending. One smart solution is to turn your old electronics into cash to fund those new purchases. It’s common to have unused electronics lying around. We hesitate to discard them because they still hold value. This unused tech represents a potential savings account that can help you afford those tempting new gadgets.

item.title: LG enV Envy Touch Phone Messaging Machine
item.description: Do you find yourself desiring a modern touchscreen phone but also require a physical QWERTY keyboard? The new LG enV Touch eliminates this dilemma by offering both! When closed, the “enV Touch” resembles a typical touchscreen smartphone. The exterior features a 3-inch, 800x480 pixel color TFT touchscreen with tactile feedback and customizable shortcuts. However, a hidden surprise awaits inside: a second 3-inch, 800x400 pixel color display. This internal screen, paired with a spacious QWERTY keyboard, prioritizes efficient typing over touch input.

item.title: Making Money With Other People's Cell Phones
item.description: It’s commonly believed that cell phones are costly. However, imagine using your desired phone and service without any expense, even turning it into a source of income. This can be achieved using other people’s old cell phones. Begin by acquiring a phone for free. Skip cell phone stores and electronics retailers; they require payment. Instead, browse online retailers like Wirefly, explore their special offers, and choose a free or rebate-eligible phone.

item.title: Your Cell Phone Is A Tool For International Business
item.description: If you do business internationally, your cell phone can be a valuable tool for staying connected with clients abroad. While your current cell phone plan might cover local and domestic long-distance calls, it could be expensive or even impossible to make international calls. You might find yourself waiting to use your landline or VoIP service, which can be inconvenient and even cause you to lose business. A better solution is to use a low-cost international dial-around service.

item.title: I Shall Call It Cellular Mini-Me
item.description: The change from landlines to mobile phones is accelerating as 3G networks expand coverage to suburban and rural areas. Smartphones like the BlackBerry and iPhone are becoming ubiquitous, prompting questions about the necessity of laptops. Wireless technology offers liberation from desktops, allowing users to communicate, browse, and enjoy videos on the move. However, this freedom is often hindered indoors. Indoor spaces present a significant obstacle to wireless transmission. Walls and other barriers weaken high-frequency radio signals, leading to dropped calls and poor connectivity.

item.title: A Vu to an iPhone Kill
item.description: The Apple iPhone 3G is the current target for every cell phone company, indicating its leading position in the market. While iPhone enthusiasts might find alternatives underwhelming, the LG Vu smartphone offers a compelling option with unique features. One standout feature is live TV. The LG Vu CU920 supports AT&T’s MEdia FLO, a subscription-based digital TV service delivered through a dedicated over-the-air broadcasting system, requiring specific hardware in compatible phones.

item.title: Get Your BlackBerry 8830 Before President Obama
item.description: President Obama famously missed his BlackBerry 8830 after prioritizing security during his initial days in office. Now, there’s news that he might be reunited with his BlackBerry, equipped with specialized software for secure communication. You, however, can enjoy the RIM BlackBerry 8830 World Edition right away, even without the special government features. This standard model caters to both personal and business needs. The BlackBerry 8830 World Edition eliminates the need for separate phones for domestic and international use.

item.title: Is Your Old RAZR Getting Dull?
item.description: The Motorola RAZR V3, known for its slim profile, is a highly sought-after mobile phone. Its popularity is evident across various carriers, even prepaid services like AT&T’s GoPhone. While the original RAZR remains desirable, those considering an upgrade will find that the RAZR design has evolved. Newer models offer the classic RAZR aesthetic with enhanced features. One notable upgrade is the Motorola RAZR 2 V8 with myFaves, available for T-Mobile. Also called the MOTORAZR, this model boasts a slimmer and more tapered design than its boxy V3 predecessor.

item.title: Your Smartphone Business Office
item.description: Microelectronics have brought us the era of the portable office, enabling employees and independent professionals to work from anywhere. This freedom is thanks to the smartphone, which combines a cell phone and a computer. While each uses its own wireless network, they work together to support your work. Voice communication happens through the cell phone. Many professionals use Bluetooth headsets, not just to free their hands but also to view the screen and utilize apps while talking.

item.title: Cricket Offers Advantages For Urban Dwellers
item.description: Are you constantly on your cell phone, talking or texting? Do you live in or around a city and use the internet frequently outside your home or work? If so, Cricket Wireless has cellular service deals that might be perfect for you. Cricket Wireless operates differently than traditional cell phone providers. First, there are no contracts. Second, most services are unlimited with one exception. Plans range from $30 to $60 per month, all offering unlimited service.

item.title: DROID is the Woid
item.description: Motorola and Verizon have partnered to challenge the dominant Apple iPhone with their highly anticipated DROID phone. Powered by the Google Android 2.0 operating system, the DROID promises exceptional functionality. Let’s explore its features. A key distinction between the iPhone and most other smartphones, aside from the BlackBerry Storm, is the inclusion of a physical keyboard. For those accustomed to texting on physical keys, transitioning to a touchscreen keyboard can be challenging.

item.title: Empire Building With Text Messages
item.description: Ever imagine being a leader, a guiding expert, the head of a powerful domain? Do you relish the idea of directing thousands of followers, no matter where they are? Want to make sure your valuable insights or secret information are seen while they’re still relevant? Or maybe you just want to organize an event, send special offers to your customers, or send urgent messages to all your employees, students, or members?

item.title: Marco, it's Polo on Your Mobile
item.description: Fashion giant Ralph Lauren is taking shopping to the next level by moving beyond online stores and embracing mobile shopping via cell phones. This shift, known as mobile or m-commerce, is poised to become as significant as e-commerce has been in recent times. Its success relies on internet-enabled smartphones and mobile-friendly websites designed for smaller screens, along with advancements like barcode scanning software and web-connected vending machines. Why the focus on cell phone shopping?

item.title: How Sprint Gives You Simply Everything
item.description: Major cell phone companies have realized that many people want unlimited talk time without worrying about exceeding their minutes. Sprint takes this a step further by offering a $99.99 monthly plan called “Simply Everything,” which provides limitless usage. As the name suggests, “Simply Everything” truly lives up to its name. For $99.99 per month, users enjoy unlimited talk time. Whether it’s day or night, weekday or weekend, local or long distance, within or outside their home area, all minutes are included without any extra charges.

item.title: Save the Cell Phone, Save the World
item.description: Cell phones are frequently overlooked as a source of environmental concern, valuable resources, and potential income. While seemingly harmless, these devices contain toxic materials and represent a significant waste problem due to their short lifespans and frequent replacement. A cell phone’s small size and durable exterior might make it seem environmentally benign, but the internal components tell a different story. Lead, cadmium, arsenic, mercury, plastics, and glass are all found within these devices.

item.title: Would You Eat This Cell Phone?
item.description: Electronic waste is a significant environmental concern, leading communities to implement recycling initiatives for electronics like TVs and computers. While sending old devices to recyclers is helpful, addressing the problem at its source is crucial. Our reliance on electronics is undeniable, and reverting to a world without them is improbable. However, we must acknowledge the environmental impact of discarding billions of electronic devices. Recycling is a positive step, but designing less toxic electronics is even more effective.

item.title: Add International Capability To Your Cell Phone
item.description: The increasing popularity of wireless phones allows mobile professionals to stay connected consistently. However, international calls remain a challenge due to expensive rates. Fortunately, there’s a solution: international dial-around services. These services, such as TEL3Advantage, seamlessly integrate with existing cell phone plans. Essentially, they allow users to make international calls at significantly reduced rates by routing them through the dial-around service instead of their regular carrier. For example, TEL3Advantage offers a rate of 1.

item.title: Times Are Tough, Cell Phones Are Free
item.description: With the current economic climate, most people are looking for ways to save money. Instead of spending lavishly, it’s wiser to be cautious and prepare for potential tough times ahead. One way to save money is by finding deals on essential items like cell phone services and devices. Many people purchase their cell phones from carrier stores or large retailers, but these places often charge a premium for the phones themselves.

item.title: Trunk Calls Soothe Lonely Elephants
item.description: The rapid development of smartphone apps, particularly after the iPhone’s release, has provided solutions for almost every need. But could technology address something as unique as an elephant’s loneliness? Interestingly, a simple cell phone offered a solution for two elephants, Devi and Rahul, at the Okinawa Zoo. When these Bengal elephants were relocated from India, they became despondent and difficult to manage without their familiar trainers, known as mahouts. To address this, the zookeepers devised a heartwarming solution: they used cell phones to allow the elephants to hear the voices of their mahouts back in India.

item.title: Have SIM, Will Travel
item.description: SIM Simminy, SIM Simminy, SIM SIM Siree Having the right phone is essential for international travel. Traveling to a foreign country can be exciting, but discovering your cell phone is unusable can put a damper on your trip. Without a working phone, you’ll be stuck using expensive hotel phones to stay in touch. Fortunately, with a little planning, you can avoid this problem. The key is to ensure your cell phone is compatible with the network used in your destination country.

item.title: Do You Have The Instinct For Covert Ops?
item.description: Ever imagine yourself as a secret agent like Jack Bauer from the show “24”? The Samsung Instinct phone, especially in sleek black, is your gateway to that world. Packed with features, it’s the ultimate device for any aspiring operative. The large, high-resolution touchscreen provides crystal-clear visuals and even vibrates slightly when you touch it, ensuring precise navigation. Its powerful 2.0 Megapixel camera captures high-quality photos and videos suitable for sharing or printing.

item.title: Is MagicJack The Next Ma Bell?
item.description: The telephone industry is facing challenges as young people are increasingly abandoning traditional landlines, which were once considered essential by previous generations. The breakup of the Bell System into smaller regional companies suggests that the era of a single, all-encompassing telephone provider is over. However, the story doesn’t end there. While it’s true that cell phones have replaced landlines for a significant portion of the population, particularly among younger demographics who have grown up with wireless technology, the evolution of the industry goes beyond this shift.

item.title: Will Cell Phones Replace Laptop Computers?
item.description: Laptops have taken over as the primary mobile work tool, but their days may be numbered. They are bulky, heavy, and require constant charging. A simple legal pad is starting to look more appealing in comparison. The search is on for a mobile device that offers the right balance of power and portability. Could the answer be cell phones? The idea of an all-in-one cell phone is appealing because most people carry one anyway.

item.title: 866 Toll Free Numbers
item.description: Everyone knows about 800 numbers; they were the original toll-free option. But did you know there are others, like 866? Is it truly toll-free? Yes, 866 is indeed toll-free. It functions identically to 800; the difference is simply in the prefix. Just like area codes (202 for Washington, DC, 302 for Delaware), these prefixes are assigned nationwide. This highlights a key difference: toll prefixes are location-specific (area codes), while toll-free prefixes are not.

item.title: Going Rogue But Not Rouge With Samsung
item.description: If you’re a go-getter in need of a powerful cell phone that won’t let you down, the Samsung Rogue U960 Black for Verizon Wireless is a top contender among smartphones. Does your current phone offer easy access to social media apps like Facebook and MySpace? How about web browsing, YouTube videos, and photo editing on a bright screen, even in sunlight? Can you stream music wirelessly, get directions, or message easily with a physical QWERTY keyboard?

item.title: Keith and Bill-O on the Small Screen
item.description: The ongoing, very public disagreement between news anchors Keith Olbermann and Bill O’Reilly is a must-watch for many, with Olbermann leaning left and O’Reilly leaning right. Now, you don’t have to miss a moment of their debates, or any other news for that matter. MediaFLO USA is introducing three 24/7 news channels to its mobile TV lineup: MSNBC, CNBC, and FOX News, all accessible on your compatible cell phone. Anyone who regularly watches these major news channels on cable or satellite understands the feeling of missing out when away from home, especially during major events or when your favorite show is airing.

item.title: Drowning in a Sea of Cell Phones
item.description: Current estimations show approximately three billion mobile phone users globally, with a billion new devices sold annually. Given that phones are typically replaced every two to three years, this equates to roughly one billion phones becoming obsolete yearly. The question then arises: where do these discarded devices end up? Contrary to assumptions that they are forgotten in drawers, a recent study revealed that only 44% of old phones remain unused at home.

item.title: Your Ally In The Android vs iPhone Battle
item.description: LG’s initial Android offering, the LG Ally for Verizon Wireless, is a remarkable device. It boasts a range of features and access to a vast library of apps on the Android Market. If you prioritize texting and email, you’ll appreciate the tactile feedback of real keys. The LG Ally features a 3.2-inch touchscreen and a slide-out QWERTY keyboard with well-sized keys. With five customizable home screens, you can personalize it with numerous Android apps.

item.title: Fixed Mobile Convergence Includes Android and iPhone
item.description: Network convergence typically focuses on combining LAN, MAN, and WAN technologies to support various data types like voice and video. This convergence is key to the advantages offered by enterprise VoIP solutions, such as increased productivity and reduced costs. However, there’s often a missing link: mobile phones. This is where Fixed Mobile Convergence (FMC) comes in. Smartphones have become so essential that excluding them from corporate communication systems creates a significant gap.

item.title: Green Solution For Old Cell Phones
item.description: Do you secretly collect old cell phones? It seems like everyone has a drawer or basement corner filled with them, all sharing one common trait: they no longer work. The issue with cell phones is that they become outdated long before they stop working. While some might suffer accidental drops or crushing defeats, most could easily be revived with a simple charge and a cellular service plan. However, that’s where the catch lies - the cost of the plans.

item.title: Buy, Buy BlackBerry
Media Flos to Mobile TV
item.description: Television is everywhere. While it started with over-the-air broadcasts, it quickly spread to cable, satellite, and the internet through platforms like YouTube and IPTV. Now, mobile devices like cell phones are the new frontier for watching TV on the go. Early mobile video relied on downloadable clips using cellular broadband networks like EV-DO. However, these networks struggle with bandwidth limitations, making it difficult to deliver high-quality real-time video without overloading the system.
